abstract: The Upshot; data from Democratic analysys firm Civis Analytics shows Donald J Trump's presidential campaign is most strongly supported by Republicans who are poor, poorly educated and less likely to vote; data also shows his support is extremely strong among self-identified Republicans registered as Democrats; situation presents conundrum to his party, which is finding core voters who support Trump are alienating younger and nonwhite voters, bloc essential to future.
lead_paragraph: In a survey, he also excels among low-turnout voters and among the less affluent and the less educated, so the question is: Will they show up to vote?

headline.main: Donald Trump’s Strongest Supporters: A Certain Kind of Democrat
headline.print_headline: Trump’s Strongest Supporter: A Certain Kind of Democrat

snippet: In a survey, he also excels among low-turnout voters and among the less affluent and the less educated, so the question is: Will they show up to vote?
